input:
Context: Aubrey directed Lee's course, and Lee ended up being a very successful doctor. 
 Question: Why did Aubrey do this? 
 Options: (A) practice medicine (B) make sure Lee had a good career (C) make sure Lee lost their career

Context: Austin took us to the city. It was in Austin. He was a Texan. 
 Question: How would you describe Austin? 
 Options: (A) very knowledgeable (B) helpful and proud (C) a Texan

Context: Cameron sold many of Sasha's coins at good prices to the people. 
 Question: Why did Cameron do this? 
 Options: (A) get the coins priced and appraised (B) wanted to get more money (C) pick up the coins from Sasha

Context: Aubrey made a picture of her friend's family and showed Remy's mom when it was done. 
 Question: How would Remy feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) would be mad at her mom (B) would be glad her mom saw the picture (C) would not want to see Aubrey

Context: Carson had a vacation planned soon and was looking forward to it. 
 Question: How would Carson feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) happy (B) Anxious (C) excited

Context: Addison's sister explained that she really wanted a boyfriend so Addison set her up on a date. 
 Question: How would the family feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) excited for Addison's sister (B) worried for Addison's sister (C) stupid

Context: Jesse wanted to leave the country so Jesse took a plane to france. 
 Question: What will Jesse want to do next? 
 Options: (A) Get a new identity (B) needed to buy a ticket (C) Fly back home

Context: Kendall provided food for people who were at the shelter during the ice storm that knocked out many people's electricity. 
 Question: How would Kendall feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) like he was dumb to spend money (B) like he had done a good job (C) they all had to pay him back

Context: Casey went to eat with Cameron's father to get to know him better. 
 Question: Why did Casey do this? 
 Options: (A) be on good terms (B) take him on a date (C) know cameron's father

Context: Sydney met Addison halfway at the stairs to congratulate them on their recent pregnancy. 
 Question: How would Addison feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) loved (B) despised (C) excited and polite

Context: Sasha got caught playing in the rain, so went inside with their father. 
 Question: Why did Sasha have to go inside? 
 Options: (A) talk to their father (B) come in out of the rain (C) apologize to her father

Context: Remy spent the whole day at an amusement park and was tired now, but Remy was still happy. 
 Question: What will Remy want to do next? 
 Options: (A) invite his friends to the amusement park (B) get a good night's rest (C) spend more time at the amusement park

Context: Jordan found Jan's keys out in the back yard so he picked it up and gave it to Jan. 
 Question: What will happen to Jan? 
 Options: (A) be able to bake the cake (B) be able to unlock the door (C) be thanked by Jan

Context: Austin was not a very well trained dog, so when Skylar asked for a kiss, Austin bit Skylar's lower lip pretty hard. 
 Question: What will Austin want to do next? 
 Options: (A) play with toys with Skylar (B) hit the dog (C) punish the dog

Context: Jesse made Remy really happy when they cooked them their favorite lunch. 
 Question: Why did Jesse do this? 
 Options: (A) understand Remy (B) So their friend would have something good (C) know how to cook

Context: Jan killed Alex's father because he had been having an affair for years. 
 Question: How would Alex feel after? 
 Options: (A) excited to be free (B) depressed about losing her father (C) happy about what Jan did

Context: Skylar took command and changed Austin's name to something embarassing. 
 Question: What will Skylar want to do next? 
 Options: (A) refuse next (B) make fun of Austin (C) annihilate Austin

Context: Taylor wanted the patient to feel better so Taylor improved the patients mood. 
 Question: How would Others feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) happy to have helped someone else (B) Glad that Taylor did that for them (C) proud of himself for helping them

Context: Remy saw lust in Jordan's eyes and became alarmed when Jordan started to move towards them. 
 Question: What will Remy want to do next? 
 Options: (A) move to the front of the room (B) reach for their goals (C) move slowly away from Jordan

Context: casey drove a reliable car so he got to work safely everyday. 
 Question: How would you describe Casey? 
 Options: (A) as odd (B) as normal (C) quite amazed

Context: Aubrey ate the same desert every night before she laid down. 
 Question: How would Aubrey feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) full (B) get more of her desert (C) likes desert

Context: Austin influenced people's ideas. He was very good at this and loved the fact that he could influence people. 
 Question: How would Austin feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) indifferent (B) capable (C) thank Austin for the help

Context: Cameron tried to work on commission as a stock broker. They made almost nothing. 
 Question: What will Cameron want to do next? 
 Options: (A) ask for a promotion (B) try something else (C) wanted to get rich

Context: Taylor needed new shoes, so he can train for the big race this weekend. 
 Question: How would Taylor feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) lazy (B) conflicted (C) proud

Context: Carson tore Jesse's eyes away with his brand new red sports car. 
 Question: What does Carson need to do before this? 
 Options: (A) whistle to get attention (B) play loud music (C) drive the car over to Jesse's

Context: Skylar took a week off from work because they needed a vacation. Skylar decided to go hiking. 
 Question: How would you characterize Skylar? 
 Options: (A) someone who loves hiking (B) unemployed (C) someone who never goes hiking

Context: Sasha wanted to sneak out of the house but Sasha decided to listen to her mom instead. 
 Question: What will happen to Sasha? 
 Options: (A) be punished for being bad (B) resent sasha (C) be rewarded for being good

Context: Jordan grew crops which he then produced annually after much laboring. 
 Question: Why did Jordan do this? 
 Options: (A) thought the crops would be pretty (B) needed to sell the crops for money (C) eat the crops

Context: Quinn sent gifts away to the others because it was christmas. 
 Question: How would Others feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) very mad (B) not happy (C) very grateful

Context: Carson wanted to take Kai on a date but wanted it to be casual. 
 Question: What will Carson want to do next? 
 Options: (A) take kai to an opera (B) be more relaxed (C) ask kai out to dinner

Context: Casey read aloud to Sydney to help her fall asleep. 
 Question: What will Sydney want to do next? 
 Options: (A) shut the door (B) go to school next (C) go to sleep next

Context: Skylar was generous and gave Tracy an opportunity to prove their worth. 
 Question: How would Tracy feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) eager to prove themselves (B) mad at skylar (C) hoping to fail

Context: After things had been getting heated for a while, Kendall kissed Quinn's neck. 
 Question: What will Quinn want to do next? 
 Options: (A) take off their clothes (B) force themselves on Kendall (C) going on

Context: Jan opened a store with specialty goods. 
 Question: How would Jan feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) an entrepreneur (B) Accomplished (C) Lazy

Context: Kai needed a ride home from the bar. Robin took Kai home. 
 Question: How would Robin feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) needed (B) useless (C) happy they are home

Context: Carson and their three buddies lived together but after Carson stole from the landlord, Carson was evicted from their apartment leaving the others still there. 
 Question: How would Others feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) a thief (B) pity for Carson (C) a horrible person

Context: Robin has big goals. They achieved progress in life. 
 Question: Why did Robin do this? 
 Options: (A) wanted to be somebody (B) blames other people (C) thank a friend

Context: Sasha wanted to become a scientist but was concerned that they would not make the grades so they got a tutor to help and ended up spendig a bunch of money studying. 
 Question: What does Sasha need to do before this? 
 Options: (A) needed to pick the wrong course (B) needed to save up money (C) doesn't want to fail

Context: Ash bought Jordan a diamond necklace from the store. Ash took Jordan's breath away. 
 Question: What will happen to Jordan? 
 Options: (A) refuse it (B) be thanked (C) wear it

Context: Riley couldn't help but notice Sydney and so she made fun of Sydney every day. 
 Question: How would you describe Riley? 
 Options: (A) regretful of her decision (B) a very jealous person (C) polite and gentle

Context: Bailey told the time wrong so people would be late. 
 Question: What will Bailey want to do next? 
 Options: (A) think up the wrong time (B) take advantage of her dishonesty (C) check the right time

Context: Taylor said that Bailey would go with her to a concert. 
 Question: What will Taylor want to do next? 
 Options: (A) give Bailey a call (B) stay at home (C) take a nap

Context: Jan helped Cameron's family move into their new home. 
 Question: What will Jan want to do next? 
 Options: (A) help move their stuff (B) wanted to be kind (C) ask for payment

Context: Casey asked Jesse to consult on their business plan.  Jesse increased Casey's profits. 
 Question: What is Casey likely to do in the future? 
 Options: (A) keep working (B) Ask Jesse for more business advice (C) work hard

Context: Robin gave their friend a decent haircut and they enjoyed it a lot. 
 Question: What will Robin want to do next? 
 Options: (A) keep cutting hair (B) get more haircuts from Robin (C) retire from their work

Context: Kai protected everyone's rights when he stood up for them at the protest. 
 Question: How would Kai feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) cowardly (B) strong (C) weak

Context: Taylor cut Casey's arm on accident when they were playing. 
 Question: What will Casey want to do next? 
 Options: (A) be reckless (B) get a bandage next (C) go swimming next

Context: Lee opened the lid. 
 Question: How would you describe Lee? 
 Options: (A) lazy (B) unable to do things for themselves (C) capable

Context: Bailey, who was usually bullied, was surprised when Austin showed kindness instead. 
 Question: How would Austin feel afterwards? 
 Options: (A) relieved (B) annoyed (C) kind

Context: Jesse thanked Bailey's boss for Bailey's support even though Bailey hardly did any of the work. 
 Question: How would Bailey feel as a result? 
 Options: (A) vindicated (B) hateful (C) grateful
